instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green goes to orange real fast even without battery
threads.message:
[U][B]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green goes to orange real fast even without battery
Rails[/B][/U]
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.6 
3V42 = 3V42
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3V3
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5V

Wont turn on does this one use power pads cant find?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green goes to orange real fast even without battery
threads.message: should turn on by itself, was this water damage??? Where?? <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> is jumping or try to comes high for a second??? (better to use oscilloscope for measure this), <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> jumping or show any voltage??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green goes to orange real fast even without battery
threads.message: Its water dmged.. very little water dmg by <CAPACITOR>C7202</CAPACITOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green goes to orange real fast even without battery
threads.message: no voltage reading on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> i dont have oscilloscope

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green goes to orange real fast even without battery
threads.message: Check the usual, corrosion <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, around SPI chip, clock chip and check trace from <CAPACITOR>C7202</CAPACITOR> to <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> of course.
